articles.title: About this site
articles.contents:
About Me
I’m Nuo Wen Lei from Shanghai, currently studying as a rising Senior at Concord Academy, MA with an interest in Computer Science, Data Science, and Behavioral Sciences. I like to play tennis, watch anime, and eat chicken wings and ramen.
About the Project
Influence of Foreign-Connected PAC Donations on Representation in the US government
Political Action Committees (PAC) are organizations that raise money to elect or beat candidates. Companies from foreign countries are able to donate to candidates through PACs, so this project aims to examine how foreign-connected PAC donations influence elections and party representation in the US.
Goals
Visualize distribution of donations from countries over time
Examine change of US government representation along with donation amount over time
x axis are different scales, so must convert to percentage before facet-wrapping

Determine connection between foreign-connected PAC donations of different parties and US government representation of the parties
“This is Data Science”
Preceptor

Kane’s Free High School Data Science Bootcamp

articles.title: PAC Donations Mapped by Countries
articles.description: Visualization of amount of donations changing over time.
articles.contents:
Country Plot



Find a country you know!
Overall, it seems that whenever there is a change of party in office, there is also a drastic change in amount donated to that party.

articles.title: Foreign-Connected PAC Donation Influence on US Politics
articles.description: This website examines the influence of foreign-connected PAC (Political Action Comittee) donations on US politics and elections.
articles.contents:
Overview of PAC Influence on US Congress Representation






Correlation Between House of Representative and Donation Percentages: 0.692
Correlation Between Senate and Donation Percentages: 0.528
From the plots, it seems that the party representation in Congress almost parallels the trend of foreign-connected PAC donations.
In fact, looking closely, the trend of donations seem the predict the representation as the changes in donations happen earlier than the changes in representation.
Additionally, it seems that Republicans usually receive more PAC donations than Democrats, but the percentage of donations of the Democrats seem to be growing closer to that of Republicans in recent years.

articles.title: PAC Donations Mapped by Regions
articles.description: Visualization of amount of donations changing over time.
articles.contents:
Region Plot



Europe donates much more than other regions to US Political Action Committees.
Overall, it seems that whenever there is a change of party in office, there is also a drastic change in amount donated to that party.

articles.title: Source A
articles.contents:
Source A was from OpenSecrets Foreign-Connected PACs.
It lists all the foreign-connected company donations for PACs from 2000 to 2020.(Foreign-Connected PACs 2020)



Foreign-Connected PACs. 2020.

articles.contents:
Source B was from a Wikipedia page about Party Division in US Congress.
It has a table recording the party representation in US Congress from 1789 to 2020.[@wikipediaPartyDivision]
